III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206 Staff qualifications.
Section (1) An agency shall require a staff member who has ongoing
Description contact with children or parents to be a person who has the ability,
experience, education, and training to perform the duties
assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 3/4/2023 a youth and staff member engaged in a physical
altercation at the agency. The staff member was intoxicated at the
time of the incident and is currently hospitalized due to injuries
resulting from the altercation.
Investigation INTERVIEWS
Program Manager was interviewed at the independent living
home on 3/8/2023. The interview was conducted along with DHHS
Worker 1. Program Manager reported that she received a text on
3/4/2023 from Staff 2 stating that there was a fire at the
independent living home. She stated that she thought this meant
there was an actual fire, so she called Staff 1 to find out what was
going on. She reported Youth A answered Staff 1’s phone and
when she asked where Staff 1 was, Youth A told her “we had to
beat his ass.” Program Manager heard Youth B in the background
saying he had to call the police and heard Youth A tell Youth B to
not call 911 and they had to get their stories straight. Youth A
asked Program Manager to Face Time him at which time she saw
the injured Staff 1. Program Manager stated when she saw Staff
1’s face, which was swollen, gashed, and bleeding, she spoke to
her husband, Chief Administrator and told him someone needed
to get to the house after which she called 911. Program Manager
reported Staff 1 is currently in the hospital with a fractured skull,
fractured eye socket, a broken nose, and a gash across his face.
2

She reported she was at the hospital for a family member on
3/5/2023 and was able to visit with Staff 1 in his room. She stated
he told her he was out on the front porch of the independent living
home smoking a Black and Mild when he saw Youths A & Youth B
walking up to the house. They all went inside, and the youths went
upstairs. Staff 1 smelled marijuana smoke, so he went upstairs,
spoke to Youth A and confiscated the marijuana. Youth A
threatened to beat up Staff 1 if he didn’t give the marijuana back
to him. Staff 1 went outside and called his mom, asking her to pick
him up because the youths were trying to fight him. The youths
came outside, so Staff 1 tried talking with them, at which time,
Youth A hit him, and Youth B pushed him. Staff 1 told Program
Manager he doesn’t remember anything after that. The meeting
with Program Manager ended at that point due to Youth B’s
Probation Officer arriving. Program manager emailed a written
statement on 3/9/2022 in which she reported Youth A told her on
3/5/2023 that on 3/4/2023, Staff 1 was following and antagonizing
Youth A and Youth B around the house. Youth A told Program
Manager Staff 1 was drunk and slurring his words. Youth A told
Program Manager he doesn’t remember what specifically started
the argument between Youth A and Staff 1, but Staff 1 went
outside and started crying and walked down the road. Youth A &
Youth B decided to walk to the store and Staff 1 followed them.
Youth A told Program Manager that he and Youth B told Staff 1 to
stop following them multiple times and Youth B eventually told
Staff 1 he would hit him if he didn’t stop following them. Staff 1
replied “you aint gonna do shit” which is when Youth B hit Staff 1.
He fell, got back up, then Youth B hit him again. Both youths were
fighting Staff 1 then Youth A told Youth B they should go back to
the house to avoid being seen by the cops. Youth A told Program
Manager Staff 1 followed the youths back to the house and
continued to antagonize them. Youth A reported to Program
Manager he grabbed a shovel from the house and hit Staff 1 while
Youth B grabbed a broom and hit Staff 1 with it until it broke.
Youth A told Program Manager he and Youth B hit Staff 1 with 4
different poles and Youth B hit Staff 1 with a pole in the head until
he bled while Youth A hit him in the legs with another pole. Youth
A told Program Manager they figured if they hit him “with enough
pain” Staff 1 would leave them alone. Staff 1 was wobbling while
walking, so the youths helped him back to the house. Youth A told
Program Manager he found a vodka bottle in Staff 1’s pocket.
Youth B was interviewed at the independent living home on
3/8/2023. The interview was conducted along with DHHS Worker
1. Youth B is over the age of 18, not a DHHS ward, and had a
scheduled meeting with his probation officer at the time of the
3

interview, so his father was present. Youth B reported Staff 1 has
worked at the independent living home for 2 weeks and he his
typically “cool” and a good staff. He reported that, on Saturday,
the staff arrived at work at 3:00 pm and was “cool” and joking
around with Youth B. Youth B reported Staff 1 seemed drunk
because he was slurring, stumbling, and smelled like liquor. Youth
B stated, when Youth A came home from work around 7pm, he
and Youth A left to walk to the store because Staff 1 was acting
“goofy.” Youth B reported Youth A attempted to call someone from
the agency, he doesn’t know who, to tell them that something was
“off” with Staff 1. Youth B reported Staff 1 was following them and
getting into Youth B’s face, so the youths told Staff 1 to leave
them alone. Youth B stated Staff 1 walked up to him and got in his
face, so Youth B punched him. The youths started to walk away,
and Staff 1 got in Youth B’s face again, so he punched him again.
Youth B reported Staff 1 tried to smack Youth A, so Youth B
punched him and “just kept punching him.” Youth B stated he told
Youth A not to hit him, but Youth A “jumped” Staff 1. Youth B
stated Staff 1 got up and followed the youths back to the house
where Staff 1 grabbed his backpack. Youth B stated he didn’t
know what was in the backpack, so he hit Staff 1 in the face with a
pole he grabbed from the house. Staff 1 dropped to his knees as
he started to walk down the street, so Youth A & Youth B helped
him back into the house where they helped to clean him up. Youth
B stated he felt bad, so he called 911. He also called Foster Care
Worker and Program Manager, but neither of them answered, so
he called Staff 2. The police and an ambulance arrived, and Staff
1 was taken away by ambulance. Youth B was arrested, after
which he spent 1 night in jail.
Youth A was interviewed at the agency office 3/8/2023. The
interview was conducted along with DHHS Worker 1. Youth A
stated Staff 1 has worked at the home for 2 weeks and Youth A
has always felt safe with him there. On 3/4/2023, Youth A got off
from working a 6-hour shift at 7:40pm. He said the door of the
independent living home opened as he walked up as if Staff 1 was
waiting for him. Youth A stated Staff 1 was acting a little drunk
because he was talking “crazy” and almost fell down. Youth B told
Youth A that Staff 1 was acting weird. Youth A stated he told Staff
1 to leave him alone and went upstairs at which time Youth B said
they had to get out of the house and go to the store. Youth A
came back downstairs to put on his shoes and go to the store with
Youth B and Staff 1 kept “clowning” with him. Youth A left with
Youth B to go to the store and Staff 1 followed them. Youth A and
Youth B told Staff 1 to stop following them 5 times then Youth B
hit Staff 1 in the face. Staff 1 got up and tried to hit Youth A, so
4

Youth B punched Staff 1 again. Youth A stated he hit Staff 1 as
well and then told Youth B they had to go back to the house
because they made a scene in front of the neighbors. Youth A
stated Staff 1 followed them “talking shit.” Youth A stated he hit
Staff 1 again in the driveway of the home. Staff 1 told him he hit
“like a bitch” after which Youth B hit him. Youth A stated they were
scared because Staff 1 just kept getting up after they hit him. Staff
1 took off his backpack and Youth B grabbed a fence post and hit
Staff 1 in the head. Staff 1 fell to the ground then got up, walked
away from the house, then fell again. Youth B stated they had hit
him too hard and needed to help him, so they helped Staff 1 back
to the house to clean him up and stop the bleeding. Youth A
stated that, while they were cleaning up Staff 1, they found a blue
New Amsterdam liquor bottle in his pocket. Youth A reported they
called Staff 2 to let him know what was happening. Youth A
reported the police arrived and took Youth B, and an ambulance
took Staff 1. Youth A denied calling anyone at any point to inform
them Staff 1 was drunk.
Foster Care Worker, who is also the complainant, was
interviewed at the agency office 3/8/2023. The interview was
conducted along with DHHS Worker 1. Foster Care Worker
reported that on 3/4/2023 she received a call from a staff on her
personal phone to tell her that there was a fight at the home.
Youth A face timed her so she could see Staff 1. She stated she
saw that Staff 1 was bleeding and had a swollen eye. She
reported he was slurring while talking to her which she attributed
to having been hit. She stated by the time she arrived at the home
Youth B had been arrested and Staff 1 was gone in the
ambulance. She reported Youth A told her he had hit Staff 1 four
times with a shovel, once with a fence post, and once with a pole.
Staff 1 was interviewed by phone on 3/15/2023 along with DHHS
Worker 1 who was present with Staff 1 in his home after he was
discharged from the hospital. Staff 1 reported he had worked at
the independent living home for approximately two weeks. He
stated he arrived to work at 3:00 pm on 3/4/2023 at which time no
one else was at the home. He reported he couldn’t remember the
exact time, but Youth A & Youth B arrived together at the home
sometime after 6:00PM. Staff 1 stated Youth A seemed angry
when he arrived at the home based on his body language and the
way he was talking with Youth B. Both youths came in the house
and went straight upstairs, which Staff 1 thought was suspicious.
Staff 1 went upstairs and knocked on Youth A’s open bedroom
door and asked what was going on and if he wanted to talk about
anything. Youth B was already in Youth A’s room talking with him
5

and Youth A told Staff 1 he didn’t want to talk. Staff 1 went back
downstairs and sat on a sofa near the bottom of the stairs after
which he smelled marijuana. He went back upstairs and told
Youth A he can’t smoke marijuana in the house to which Youth A
replied “I’m grown. I can do what I want.” Staff 1 made the
comment that Youth A was acting like a 10-year-old kid then went
back downstairs. Staff 1 stated he grabbed his phone and bag and
texted the team lead that he was going to go on break. He heard
Youth A and Youth B come downstairs behind him and, when he
attempted to go outside for his break, Youth A yelled a couple of
things at him. Staff 1 told Youth A to get out of the way and tried to
leave past Youth A at which time Youth A grabbed Staff 1’s bag
and started pushing and pulling Staff 1. Staff 1 got outside and
was walking away from the front of the house when someone
yelled his name. When Staff 1 turned around, he was hit in the
face with an object. He stated that he fell and “probably” got
kicked then got back to his feet after which he was hit in the face
again with an object. He reported not remembering anything after
that.
Staff 1 stated that he hasn’t had any issues with either Youth A or
Youth B previously. He denied drinking alcohol that day and
denied having any alcohol bottles in his pockets. He stated he
would consent to signing any consent forms needed to allow the
hospital to release any paperwork they had to verify his blood
alcohol level.
On 3/29/2023 DHHS Worker 1 called and stated that she went
back to Staff 1’s home to have him sign consent for release
paperwork and he refused stating that he was assaulted and did
not want to sign the documents. DHHS Worker 1 reported the
police report she received did not document anything about Staff 1
having alcohol on him at the time of the incident. DHHS Worker
stated she also spoke to the detective involved who stated the
responding officers did not make any reports or statements about
Staff 1 having alcohol on him at the time of the incident, so DHHS
Worker will be closing her case with no findings.
DOCUMENT REVIEW
• Police Report dated 3/5/2023 documenting the officer
observed Staff 1 to have a bloody shirt, bloody face, and a
laceration above his right eye. Staff 1’s right eye was also
completely swollen shut. The officer documented the
following as being reported:
-Staff 1 reported he was informing Youths A & Youth
B of their curfew and that they could not be smoking
6

weed in the home after which he was attacked by
Youths A & Youth B.
- Youth B reported he got into a fist fight with Staff 1.
- Youth B reported Staff 1 appeared highly
intoxicated, attempted to assault Youths A & Youth
B by continuously charging at and attempting to
attack them.
- Youth B reported Staff 1 was following him and
Youth A as they walked to the store, kept getting into
Youth B’s face, and attempted to assault Youth A
with a closed fist.
- Youth B reported Staff 1 struck Youth A across the
face with an open hand and Youth B struck Staff 1
with a closed fist.
- Youth B admitted to hitting Staff 1 across the face
with a pole after Staff 1 reached into his own bag
because Youth B didn’t know what Staff 1 had in the
bag.
On 3/17/2023 additional allegations were received. The
allegations alleged Youth C saw Staff 3 smoking marijuana in the
independent living home on Lansdowne with Youth A.
INTERVIEWS
Youth C was interviewed by phone on 3/17/2023. He reported,
while living at the independent living home on Lansdowne, he saw
Staff 3 smoking marijuana with Youth A. Youth C stated he did not
recall when he saw this and didn’t report it to anyone. He didn’t
have any additional information.
Staff 3 was interviewed by phone on 3/22/2023. DHHS Worker 1
was present in-person with Staff 3 for the interview. Staff 3
reported she only works at the independent living home on
Lakewood. She reported she started working for the agency in
December of 2022 and she worked her first two shift at the
Lansdowne house as training shifts. She stated she completed
these shifts with Staff 4. Staff 3 reported that during one of those
shifts, Staff 4 was showing her how to do room checks and they
discovered Youth A smoking marijuana in his room. Staff 4
completed an incident report and called Program Manager who
then came to the home. Staff 3 denied smoking marijuana with
any of the youths. She stated that she has not seen any other staff
members smoke marijuana with youths.
7

Youth A was interviewed by DHHS Worker 1 on 2/23/2023 at his
current placement in detention. DHHS Worker 1 provided notes
from the interview due to her being unable to bring a phone into
the facility to conduct a joint interview. DHHS Worker 1’s notes
indicate that Youth A reported smoking marijuana in the
independent living home on a daily basis with Staff 5. Youth A
stated he would buy the marijuana from Staff 5 for $60 per week.
Youth A did not report smoking marijuana with Staff 3.
Youth A was interviewed in person on 4/13/2023 by DCWL
Consultant 2 regarding the additional allegations reported to
DHHS Worker 1. During the interview, Youth A stated Staff 5
allowed Youth A to smoke marijuana in the home whenever Staff
5 was working. Youth A stated he only started smoking in the
home after he saw Staff 5 doing it in front of him and offering it to
him.
Staff 4 was interviewed by phone on 3/22/2023 along with DHHS
Worker 2 who was present in person. Staff 4 reported she trained
Staff 3 during Staff 3’s first 2 shifts at the Lansdowne. Staff 4
reported having found Youth C with marijuana in the home a few
times. She stated when this happened, she would confiscate the
marijuana, complete a room check, ask him to turn out his
pockets, then complete an incident report. She stated she has
never seen any staff smoke marijuana with Youth C, nor has she
heard of staff providing or selling marijuana to Youth C.
Staff 5 was interviewed by phone on 3/22/2023 along with DHHS
Worker 2 who was present in person. Staff 5 works the 11am-7pm
and 3-11pm shifts. Staff 5 reported he has never seen Youth A
smoking marijuana in the home. Staff 5 stated Youth C would
sometimes smell like marijuana and Staff 5 would find wrappers
and other marijuana related paraphernalia in Youth C’s room
during room checks, but he never caught Youth C with marijuana.
Staff 5 denied ever smoking marijuana with, selling marijuana to,
or providing marijuana to Youth C. Staff 5 stated he has not heard
of any other staff doing so either.
Staff 6 was interviewed by phone on 3/22/2023 along with DHHS
Worker 2 who was present in person. Staff 6 reported working
midnights shifts and having very little interaction with the youths
outside of conducting his hourly room checks. He stated he has
never caught Youth C smoking marijuana in the home, but he had
read shift notes from other staff documenting that they have
caught Youth C smoking marijuana in the home. He stated he has
8

never seen any staff smoke marijuana with Youth C, nor has he
heard of staff providing or selling marijuana to Youth C.
Foster Care Worker was interviewed by phone along with DHHS
Worker 2 who was present in person. Foster Care Worker
reported that Youth C never told her he smoked marijuana with
any staff. He also never told her that he purchased or was
provided any marijuana by staff.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED
• 10/10/2022 Incident Report completed by Staff 4
documenting Youth A’s room smelled like marijuana, no
other youths were present.
• 12/12/2022 Incident report completed by Staff 4
documenting Youth A was found smoking marijuana in his
closet.
• 12/28/2022 Incident Report completed by Foster Care
Worker documenting Youth A’s bedroom was filled with
smoke and his window was open indicating he had just
finished smoking.
• 1/18/2023 Incident Report completed by Life Skills Coach
documenting that Youth A was smoking marijuana in his
room.
Analysis No violation is being established as there is no evidence to
support the allegations that a staff was drunk while working or that
a staff member smoked marijuana with and sold marijuana to a
youth.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12507 Medical, dental, and mental health care
Section (1) An agency shall ensure that a youth in independent living
Description receives any needed medical, dental, and mental health care as
required in R 400.12413. Medical, dental, and mental health care
provided shall be documented in the youth’s record.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Youth did not receive any medical, dental, or mental health
services.
Investigation INTERVIEWS
Youth A was interviewed by DHHS Worker 1 on 2/23/2023 at his
current placement in detention. DHHS Worker 1 provided notes
9

from the interview due to her being unable to bring a phone into
the facility to conduct a joint interview. DHHS Worker 1’s notes
indicate that Youth A reported not receiving any medical, dental,
or mental health services while at the independent living home.
Youth A was interviewed in person by DCWL Consultant 2 on
4/13/2023 at his current detention placement. Youth A reported
that he had an asthma attack at the end of February and called an
ambulance to bring him to the hospital. He reported that no staff
were working at the time. He stated he was given a prescription
for an inhaler, but staff wouldn’t drive him to pick it up, so he had
to walk to the pharmacy. He also reported he only had one
medical appointment while at the independent living home
because staff would not assist him in making appointment and he
did not see a dentist due to staff refusing to transport him. He
stated he was participating in counseling prior to moving to the
independent living home, but staff would not transport him, so he
stopped attending. He stated they were supposed to get him
counseling closer to the agency but did not follow through.
Staff 4, Staff 5, Staff 6, and Foster Care Worker were all
interviewed individually by phone on 3/22/2023 along with DHHS
Worker 2 who was present in person. Staff 4, Staff 5, Staff 6 and
Foster Care Worker all stated Youth A did not complain about
body pain, dental pain, or any other untreated health conditions.
Staff 6 stated he once rode in an ambulance and went to the
hospital with Youth A after Youth A complained of not feeling well,
but he was released from the hospital after it was determined
there was nothing wrong. Foster Care Worker reported that Youth
A was up to date on his medical and physical examinations which
he received prior to coming to the agency. She stated that he did
need orthodontic follow-up, which they had been attempting to
schedule; however, the local providers were booked out several
months. She also stated that Youth A has scoliosis and does need
surgery, but his father needs to consent to the surgery, which he
has not yet done.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED
• Youth A’s case record documenting Placement at the IL
home 9/27/22 – 3/9/2023.
• Dental examination completed 9/28/2022 including a
referral to oral surgeon.
• A list of orthodontic/oral surgeons documenting 3 providers
covered by Youth A’s insurance one of which had no
available appointments and two of which were booked until
June 2023.
10

• Well child exam completed 7/22/2022.
• Medical forms documenting Youth A was seen for scoliosis
pain on 2/15/2023. The medical provider noted Youth A’s
last appointment for scoliosis was 4/28/2021 at which time
he lived with his brother. A 4-month follow-up was
recommended, but his brother did not bring him to the
appointment. Surgical intervention was recommended.
• MiSACWIS case file documenting mental health services
beginning 1/9/2023.
• 3/7/2023 trauma assessment.
• 3/15/2023 Email from Youth A’s therapist suspending
services due to court intervention.
Analysis No violation is established as the youth was current on his medical
and dental periodic examinations and participated in mental health
services.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
